page.title: 06RELIGION IN CHERINGTON
page.content: At a time of changing attitudes to established religious institutions, it was decided to record the affiliations and allegiances of children aged 5 to 11 in the Minchinhampton, Cherington and Avening areas. Exactly one third said they attended a place of worship regularly each Sunday. Just over one third never attend church and the remainder go just occasionally. When asked which place of worship they would attend if indeed they were to go, 75% named the Anglcan Church, with just under 25% preferring the Baptist Chapel. Clearly a wide choice was not available to worshippers, though one family recorded adherence to the Society of Friends, one to the Salvation Army and one to "Chapel". No-one questioned went to the nearby Catholic church. Only 1 child in 4 attended Sunday School.
